description: I idolize a particular hero of my faith, and constantly refer to that person's deeds and example.
I can find common ground between the fiercest enemies, empathizing with them and always working toward peace.
I see omens in every event and action. The gods try to speak to us, we just need to listen.
Nothing can shake my optimistic attitude.
I quote (or misquote) sacred texts and proverbs in almost every situation.
I am tolerant (or intolerant) of other faiths and respect (or condemn) the worship of other gods.
I've enjoyed fine food, drink, and high society among my temple's elite. Rough living grates on me.
I've spent so long in the temples that I have little practical experience dealing with people in the outside world.
The ancient traditions of worship and sacrifice must be preserved and upheld.
I always try to help those in need, no matter what the personal cost.
We must help bring about the changes the gods are constantly working in the world.
I hope to one day rise to the top of my faiths religious hierarchy.
I trust that my deity will guide my actions, I have faith that if I work hard, things will go well.
I seek to prove myself worthy of my god’s favor by matching my actions against his or her teachings.
I would die to recover an ancient relic of my faith that was lost long ago.
I will someday get revenge on the corrupt temple hierarchy who branded me a heretic.
I owe my life to the priest who took me in when my parents died.
Everything I do is for the common people.
I will do anything to protect the temple where I served.
I seek to preserve a sacred text that my enemies consider heretical and seek to destroy.
I judge others harshly, and myself even more severely.

I put too much trust in those who wield power within
my temple’s hierarchy.
My piety sometimes leads me to blindly trust those that profess faith in my god.
I am inflexible in my thinking.
I am suspicious of strangers and expect the worst of them.
Once I pick a goal, I become obsessed with it to the detriment of everything else in my life.
I cheat at games of chance.
I shave coins or forge documents.
I insinuate myself into people's lives to prey on their weakness and secure their fortunes.
I put on new identities like clothes.
I run sleight-of-hand cons on street corners.
I convince people that worthless junk is worth their hard-earned money.
I fall in and out of love easily, and am always pursuing someone.
I have a joke for every occasion, especially occasions where humor is inappropriate.
Flattery is my preferred trick for getting what I want.
I’m a born gambler who can't resist taking a risk for a potential payoff.
I lie about almost everything, even when there’s no good reason to.
Sarcasm and insults are my weapons of choice.
I keep multiple holy symbols on me and invoke whatever deity might come in useful at any given moment.
I pocket anything I see that might have some value.
I am a free spirit— no one tells me what to do. (Chaotic)
I never target people who can’t afford to lose a few coins. (Lawful)
I distribute the money I acquire to the people who really need it. (Good)
I never run the same con twice. (Chaotic)
Material goods come and go. Bonds of friendship last forever. (Good)
I’m determined to make something of myself. (Any)
I fleeced the wrong person and must work to ensure that this individual never crosses paths with me or those I care about.
I owe everything to my mentor—a horrible person who’s probably rotting in jail somewhere.
Somewhere out there, I have a child who doesn’t know me. I’m making the world better for him or her.
I come from a noble family, and one day I’ll reclaim my lands and title from those who stole them from me.
A powerful person killed someone I love. Some day soon, I’ll have my revenge.
I swindled and ruined a person who didn’t deserve it. I seek to atone for my misdeeds but might never be able to forgive myself.
I can’t resist a pretty face.
I'm always in debt. I spend my ill-gotten gains on decadent luxuries faster than I bring them in..
I’m convinced that no one could ever fool me the way I fool others.
I’m too greedy for my own good. I can’t resist taking a risk if there’s money involved.
I can’t resist swindling people who are more powerful than me.
I hate to admit it and will hate myself for it, but I'll run and preserve my own hide if the going gets tough.
You extort others for payments through intimidation and threats of injury.
You break into others' homes and shops to steal their valuables.
You are the strong arm for a crime boss, terrorizing and harming individuals for crossing your boss.
You are a distributor for buying and selling stolen goods.
You skulk the major roadways to pounce on unguarded travelers and caravans to steal their valuables.
You are contracted when other criminals want someone deprived of life, and you are just the person for the job.
You slink the streets of markets and villages deftly lifting the coin purses and jewelry from unsuspecting villagers.
You specialize in importing and exporting unlawful goods between kingdoms.
I always have a plan for what to do when things go wrong.
I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
The first thing I do in a new place is note the locations of everything valuable - or where such things could be hidden.
I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide.
I don't pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it.
I blow up at the slightest insult.
I don’t steal from others in the trade. (Lawful)
Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)
I steal from the wealthy so that I can help people in need. (Good)
I will do whatever it takes to become wealthy. (Evil)
I’m loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)
There’s a spark of good in everyone. (Good)
I’m trying to pay off an old debt I owe to a generous benefactor.
My ill-gotten gains go to support my family.
Something important was taken from me, and I aim to steal it back.
I will become the greatest thief that ever lived.
I’m guilty of a terrible crime. I hope I can redeem myself for it.
Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.
When I see something valuable, I can’t think about anything but how to steal it.
When faced with a choice between money and my friends, I usually choose the money.
If there’s a plan, I’ll forget it. If I don’t forget it, I’ll ignore it.
I have a “tell” that reveals when I'm lying.
I turn tail and run when things look bad.

An innocent person is in prison for a crime that I
committed. I’m okay with that.
You take on fictional roles and reinact their story before your audience in dramatic, comedic, tragic, or inspirational fashion.
You rhytmically move your body to the music, leaping and skipping with excitement and emotion before your audience.
You daringly play with wands of fire, often swaying them to the rhythms of music before your and climatically swalling them before your audience.
You play the part of a fool or clown with witticisms, jokes, and pranks for the delight of your audience, particularly children.
Your delight your audience by throwing (often in simultaneous motion), catching, or balancing a variety of objects.
You play a myriad songs on a musical instrument (or multiple instruments) with skill for the pleasure of your audience.
You are an author and orator of literary works with a rhythmical composition, telling of ancient kingdoms and chivalric affairs.
You are a skilled singer serenading your audience with beautiful and dramatic ballads of glory, honor, and lost love.
You orate dramatic tales of bygone battles, ghostly apparitions, and harrowing adventures with breathtaking skill for your audience.
You are a skilled gymnast using your body in daring athletic performance to jump, tumble, dodge, and catch for your audience.
I know a story relevant to almost every situation.
Whenever I come to a new place, I collect local rumors and spread gossip.
I’m a hopeless romantic, always searching for that “special someone.”
Nobody stays angry at me or around me for long, since I can defuse any amount of tension.
I love a good insult, even one directed at me.
I get bitter if I’m not the center of attention.
I’ll settle for nothing less than perfection.
I change my mood or my mind as quickly as I change key in a song.
When I perform, I make the world better than it was. (Good)
The stories, legends, and songs o f the past must never be forgotten, for they teach us who we are. (Lawful)
The world is in need of new ideas and bold action. (Chaotic)
I’m only in it for the money and fame. (Evil)
I like seeing the smiles on people’s faces when I perform. That’s all that matters. (Neutral)
Art should reflect the soul; it should come from within and reveal who we really are. (Any)
My instrument is my most treasured possession, and it reminds me of someone I love.
Someone stole my precious instrument, and someday I’ll get it back.
I want to be famous, whatever it takes.
I idolize a hero of the old tales and measure my deeds against that person’s.
I will do anything to prove myself superior to my hated rival.
I would do anything for the other members of my old troupe.
I’ll do anything to win fame and renown.
I’m a sucker for a pretty face.
A scandal prevents me from ever going home again. That kind of trouble seems to follow me around.
I once satirized a noble who still wants my head. It was a mistake that I will likely repeat.
I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.
Despite my best efforts, I am unreliable to my friends.
I stood up to a tyrant’s agents.
I saved people during a natural disaster.
I stood alone against a terrible monster.
I stole from a corrupt merchant to help the poor.
I led a militia to fight off an invading army.
I broke into a tyrant’s castle and stole weapons to arm the people.
I trained the peasantry to use farm implements as weapons against a tyrant’s soldiers.
A lord rescinded an unpopular decree after I led a symbolic act of protect against it.
A celestial, fey, or similar creature gave me a blessing or revealed my secret origin.
Recruited into a lord’s army, I rose to leadership and was commended for my heroism.
I judge people by their actions, not their words.
If someone is in trouble, I’m always ready to lend help.
When I set my mind to something, I follow through no matter what gets in my way.
I have a strong sense of fair play and always try to find the most equitable solution to arguments.
I’m confident in my own abilities and do what I can to instill confidence in others.
Thinking is for other people. I prefer action.
I misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
I get bored easily. When am I going to get on with my destiny?
People deserve to be treated with dignity and respect. (Good)
No one should get preferential treatment before the law, and no one is above the law. (Lawful)
Tyrants must not be allowed to oppress the people. (Chaotic)
If I become strong, I can take what I want - what I deserve. (Evil)
There’s no good in pretending to be something I’m not. (Neutral)
Nothing and no one can steer me away from my higher calling. (Any)
I have a family, but I have no idea where they are. One day, I hope to see them again.
I worked the land, I love the land, and I will protect the land.
A proud noble once gave me a horrible beating, and I will take my revenge on any bully I encounter.
My tools are symbols of my past life, and I carry them so that I will never forget my roots.
I protect those who cannot protect themselves.
I wish my childhood sweetheart had come with me to pursue my destiny.
The tyrant who rules my land will stop at nothing to see me killed.
I’m convinced of the significance of my destiny, and blind to my shortcomings and the risk of failure.
The people who knew me when I was young know my shameful secret, so I can never go home again.
I have a weakness for the vices of the city, especially hard drink.
Secretly, I believe that things would be better if I were a tyrant lording over the land.
I have trouble trusting in my allies.
I am associated with traders in herbs, slaves, and potions for various types of healing and enhancements.
I am familiar with the best armorsmiths and locksmiths and and the traders in their wares.
I am acquainted with those whom make wines, ales, and other spirits and the farmers and traders needed for its supplies.
I am well-informed in the business of written knowledge, its suppliers, and its employers.
I deal with contracters and engineers of construction all the time.
I am versant with explorers and mappers in the area and know where to find any necessary supplies.
I deal with shoemakers, bootmakers, cobblers, and their suppliers regularly.
I know where to find all of the good cooks, bakers, and chefs in the area - and where to find the best supplies.
I am skilled with creating glass and dealing with glaziers and glassblowers in the region.
I am proficient in crafting jewelry and gemcutting, and I know all of the best contacts in the business.
Tanning and furrying are my business and I know the trappers and hunters who can get me the best.
The monuments and temples in the area are attributed to me and the people I employ.
Only I can appreciate the artist and their craft - and I know where to buy and where to sell.
Ceramics are my specialty and I know the trade and its makers from mud to oven to paint.
I know everyone at the harbor and can find anyone to buy or sell ship supplies and even build a ship.
I know all of the best miners and caravans to buy and sell metal ores and smithy supplies.
I deal with many traders of fine mechanizations and unusual items.
I do business with all of the caravans and traders and supply the best wheels and wagons available.
Textiles are my business and I know where to find the best pigments, cloths, and weavers.
I know where to find all of the best traders and crafters of wood, including bowyers and fletchers.
I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right. I can’t help it— I’m a perfectionist.
I’m a snob who looks down on those who can’t appreciate fine art.
I always want to know how things work and what makes people tick.
I’m full of witty aphorisms and have a proverb for every occasion.
I’m rude to people who lack my commitment to hard work and fair play.
I like to talk at length about my profession.
I don’t part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly to get the best deal possible.
I’m well known for my work, and I want to make sure everyone appreciates it. I'm always taken aback when people haven’t heard of me.
It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community and the security of civilization. (Lawful)
My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world. (Good)
Everyone should be free to pursue his or her own livelihood. (Chaotic)
I’m only in it for the money. (Evil)
I’m committed to the people I care about, not to ideals. (Neutral)
I work hard to be the best there is at my craft.
The workshop where I learned my trade is the most important place in the world to me.
I created a great work for someone, and then found them unworthy to receive it. I’m still looking for someone worthy.
I owe my guild a great debt for forging me into the person I am today.
I pursue wealth to secure someone’s love.
One day I will return to my guild and prove that I am the greatest artisan of them all.
I will get revenge on the evil forces that destroyed my place of business and ruined my livelihood.
I’ll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
I’m quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
I’m never satisfied with what I have - I always want more.
I would kill to acquire a noble title.
I’m horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go, I’m surrounded by rivals.
I was searching for spiritual enlightenment.
I was partaking of communal living in accordance with the dictates of a religious order.
I was exiled for a crime I didn’t commit.
I retreated from society after a life-altering event.
I needed a quiet place to work on my art, literature, music, or manifesto.
I needed to commune with nature, far from civilization.
I was the caretaker of an ancient ruin or relic.
I was a pilgrim in search of a person, place, or relic of spiritual significance.

I’ve been isolated for so long that I rarely speak,
preferring gestures and the occasional grunt.
I am utterly serene, even in the face of disaster.
The leader of my community had something wise to say on every topic, and I am eager to share that wisdom.
I feel tremendous empathy for all who suffer.
I’m oblivious to etiquette and social expectations.
I connect everything that happens to me to a grand, cosmic plan.
I often get lost in my own thoughts and contemplation, becoming oblivious to my surroundings.
I am working on a grand philosophical theory and love sharing my ideas.
My gifts are meant to be shared with all, not used for my own benefit. (Good)
Emotions must not cloud our sense of what is right and true, or our logical thinking. (Lawful)
Inquiry and curiosity are the pillars of progress. (Chaotic)
Solitude and contemplation are paths toward mystical or magical power. (Evil)
Meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble. (Neutral)
If you know yourself, there’s nothing left to know. (Any)
Nothing is more important than the other members of my hermitage, order, or association.
I entered seclusion to hide from the ones who might still be hunting me. I must someday confront them.
I’m still seeking the enlightenment I pursued in my seclusion, and it still eludes me.
I entered seclusion because I loved someone I could not have.
Should my discovery come to light, it could bring ruin to the world.
My isolation gave me great insight into a great evil that only I can destroy.
Now that I've returned to the world, I enjoy its delights a little too much.
I harbor dark, bloodthirsty thoughts that my isolation and meditation failed to quell.
I am dogmatic in my thoughts and philosophy.
I let my need to win arguments overshadow friendships and harmony.
I’d risk too much to uncover a lost bit of knowledge.
I like keeping secrets and won’t share them with anyone.

My eloquent flattery makes everyone I talk to feel like the most wonderful and important person in the
world.

The common folk love me for my kindness and
generosity.
No one could doubt by looking at my regal bearing that I am a cut above the unwashed masses.
I take great pains to always look my best and follow the latest fashions.
I don’t like to get my hands dirty, and I won’t be caught dead in unsuitable accommodations.
Despite my noble birth, I do not place myself above other folk. We all have the same blood.
My favor, once lost, is lost forever.
If you do me an injury, I will crush you, ruin your name, and salt your fields.
Respect is due to me because of my position, but all people regardless of station deserve to be treated with dignity. (Good)
It is my duty to respect the authority of those above me, just as those below me must respect mine. (Lawful)
I must prove that I can handle myself without the coddling of my family. (Chaotic)
If I can attain more power, no one will tell me what to do. (Evil)
Blood runs thicker than water. (Any)
It is my duty to protect and care for the people beneath me. (Good)
I will face any challenge to win the approval of my family.

My house’s alliance with another noble family
must be sustained at all costs.
Nothing is more important than the other members of my family.
I am in love with the heir of a family that my family despises.
My loyalty to my sovereign is unwavering.
The common folk must see me as a hero of the people.
I secretly believe that everyone is beneath me.
I hide a truly scandalous secret that could ruin my family forever.
I too often hear veiled insults and threats in every word addressed to me, and I’m quick to anger.
I have an insatiable desire for carnal pleasures.
In fact, the world does revolve around me.

By my words and actions, I often bring shame to
my family.
You make your home in a dense tree forest and are most comfortable when you encounter other wooded realms.
You are skilled in trapping beasts for their pelts (and other parts) and are accustomed to surviving in the wilderness.
You have made your home in the hinterland surviving against the dangerous odds.
You are a skilled guide for tracking and mapping the wild areas of the realms.
Whether rightly or wrongly, you have been banished from your kingdom or tribe, forcing you to survive on your own in the wilderness.
You are skilled at traveling wilderness and towns, finding those you are paid to bring (or deliver) to justice.
You are part of a new colony (for your clan or kingdom) of settlers in an untamed wilderness, staving off wild beasts from your habitat.
You are part of a small nomadic tribe of natives that roams the wilderness, living with the lands and not destroying it with permanency.
You are part of a small clan that roams the wilderness seasonally, seeking foraging and hunting opportunities.
You are part of a war tribe that battles other clans and kingdoms for spoils of war.
I’m driven by a wanderlust that led me away from home.
I watch over my friends as if they were a litter of newborn pups.
I once ran twenty-five miles without stopping to warn my clan of an approaching orc horde. I’d do it again if I had to.
I have a lesson for every situation, drawn from observing nature.
I place no stock in wealthy or well-mannered folk. Money and manners won’t save you from a hungry owlbear.
I’m always picking things up, absently fiddling with them, and sometimes accidentally breaking them.
I feel far more comfortable around animals than people.
I was, in fact, raised by wolves.
Life is like the seasons, in constant change, and we must change with it. (Chaotic)
It is each person’s responsibility to make the most happiness for the whole tribe. (Good)
If I dishonor myself, I dishonor my whole clan. (Lawful)
The strongest are meant to rule. (Evil)
The natural world is more important than all the constructs of civilization. (Neutral)
I must earn glory in battle, for myself and my clan. (Any)
My family, clan, or tribe is the most important thing in my life, even when they are far from me.
An injury to the unspoiled wilderness of my home is an injury to me.
I will bring terrible wrath down on the evildoers who destroyed my homeland.
I am the last of my tribe, and it is up to me to ensure their names enter legend.
I suffer awful visions of a coming disaster and will do anything to prevent it.
It is my duty to provide children to sustain my tribe.
I am too enamored of ale, wine, and other intoxicants.
There’s no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest.
I remember every insult I’ve received and nurse a silent resentment toward anyone who’s ever wronged me.
I am slow to trust members of other races, tribes, and societies.
Violence is my answer to almost any challenge.
Don’t expect me to save those who can’t save themselves. It is nature’s way that the strong thrive and the weak perish.
You are practiced in the mixing of natural chemicals and magical elixirs to profound effect.
You understand the night sky, understanding the apparent movement of the stars and their relation to one another.
You were once a respected scholar who has been discredited, rightfully or wrongfully, and is now shunned by academic societies.
You are learned in a wide variety of literature and reference material, skilled in categorizing and accounting books, scrolls, and tomes.
You are qualified to teach on certain subjects having a vastly better understanding of that subject than even other academics.
You are skilled in finding specific information from a variety of sources, notably ancient texts, scrolls, and contemporary reference books.
You worked directly with a knowledgeable wizard who passed on his arcane knowledge in exchange for menial chores around the sanctum.
You were employed by a noble, a government, or a scholar to pen their words directly to scrolls or copy already-authored books.
I use polysyllabic words that convey the impression of great erudition.
I've read every book in the world’s greatest libraries - or I like to boast that I have.
I'm used to helping out those who aren’t as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.
There’s nothing I like more than a good mystery.
I’m willing to listen to every side of an argument before I make my own judgment.
I . . . speak . . . slowly . . . When talking . . . To idiots, . . . Which . . . Almost . . . Everyone . . . Is . . . Compared . . . To me.
I am horribly, horribly awkward in social situations.
I’m convinced that people are always trying to steal my secrets.
The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)
What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true. (Good)
Emotions must not cloud our logical thinking. (Lawful)
Nothing should fetter the infinite possibility inherent in all existence. (Chaotic)
Knowledge is the path to power and domination. (Evil)
The goal of a life of study is the betterment of oneself. (Any)
It is my duty to protect my students.
I have an ancient text that holds terrible secrets that must not fall into the wrong hands.
I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
My life’s work is a series of tomes related to a specific field of lore.
I've been searching my whole life for the answer to a certain question.
I sold my soul for knowledge. I hope to do great deeds and win it back.
I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
Unlocking an ancient mystery is worth the price of a civilization.
I overlook obvious solutions in favor of complicated ones.
I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.
I can’t keep a secret to save my life, or anyone else’s.
My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
I enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
I never pass up a friendly wager.
My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)
We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)
The sea is freedom—the freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)
I’m a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey. (Evil)
I’m committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)
Someday I’ll own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)
I’m loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
The ship is most important—crewmates and captains come and go.
I’ll always remember my first ship.
In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.
I follow orders, even if I think they’re wrong.
I’ll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Once I start drinking, it’s hard for me to stop.
I can’t help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
My pride will probably lead to my destruction.
You were a leader of a division on the battlefield, leading your troops into gruesome bloody battles.
You were tasked with surveillance and exploration missions for your army.
As the main force during battles, you were in the ground forces attacking as the main force, witnessing victory, defeat, and death all around.
You were part of the mounted troops (typically war horses) during wartime.
You acted as a battlefield medic, aiding and rescuing casualties from the battlefield.
You supervised stores and distributed supplies and provisions to the troops in the army.
You bore the flag for your troops' representation and communication on the battlefield.
You were part of the support staff of military campaigns, such as blacksmith, tanner, or cook.
I'm always polite and respectful.
I’m haunted by memories of war. I can’t get the images of violence out of my mind.
I’ve lost too many friends, and I’m slow to make new ones.
I’m full of inspiring and cautionary tales from my military experience relevant to almost every combat situation.
I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
I enjoy being strong and like breaking things.
I have a crude sense of humor.
I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
Our lot is to lay down our lives in defense of others. (Good)
I do what I must and obey just authority. (Lawful)
When people follow orders blindly, they embrace a kind of tyranny. (Chaotic)
In life as in war, the stronger force wins. (Evil)
Ideals aren’t worth killing over or going to war for. (Neutral)
My city, nation, or people are all that matter. (Any)
I would still lay down my life for the people I served with.
Someone saved my life on the battlefield. To this day, I will never leave a friend behind.
My honor is my life.
I’ll never forget the crushing defeat my company suffered or the enemies who dealt it.
Those who fight beside me are those worth dying for.
I fight for those who cannot fight for themselves.
The monstrous enemy we faced in battle still leaves me quivering with fear.
I have little respect for anyone who is not a proven warrior.
I made a terrible mistake in battle cost many lives - and I would do anything to keep that mistake secret.
My hatred of my enemies is blind and unreasoning.
I obey the law, even if the law causes misery.
I’d rather eat my armor than admit when I’m wrong.
I hide scraps of food and trinkets away in my pockets.
I ask a lot of questions.
I like to squeeze into small places where no one else can get to me.
I sleep with my back to a wall or tree, with everything I own wrapped in a bundle in my arms.
I eat like a pig and have bad manners.
I think anyone who’s nice to me is hiding evil intent.
I don’t like to bathe.
I bluntly say what other people are hinting at or hiding.
All people, rich or poor, deserve respect. (Good)
We have to take care of each other, because no one else is going to do it. (Lawful)

The low are lifted up, and the high and mighty are brought down. Change is the nature of things.
(Chaotic)
The rich need to be shown what life and death are like in the gutters. (Evil)
I help the people who help me—that’s what keeps us alive. (Neutral)
I'm going to prove that I'm worthy of a better life.
My town or city is my home, and I’ll fight to defend it.
I sponsor an orphanage to keep others from enduring that I was forced to endure.
I owe my survival to another urchin who taught me to live on the streets.
I owe a debt I can never repay to the person who took pity on me.
I escaped my life of poverty by robbing an important person, and I’m wanted for it.
No one else should have to endure the hardships I’ve been through.
If I'm outnumbered, I will run away from a fight.
Gold seems like a lot of money to me, and I’ll do just about anything for more of it.
I will never fully trust anyone other than myself.
I’d rather kill someone in their sleep then fight fair.
It’s not stealing if I need it more than someone else.
People who can't take care of themselves get what they deserve.
You are a soldier, or hired support, within the ranks of the enemy, reporting troop movements back to your ruler.
You are an informant of your own people, ratting on those that would betray your king.
You are a surreptitious investigator for your queen or a wealthy noble, reporting all of your findings almost invisibly.
You appear to be a commoner or merchant, when in fact you are a keen observer of the local politics, reporting all.
You are a charismatic diplomat with the true intention of observing and spying every move of your host kingdom to your proprietor.
You have infiltrated an enemy guild, noble house, or even the royal family, reporting on their every move.
You infiltrate enemy royal houses or esteemed guilds to find their weaknesses, terrorize, and destroy them!
You penetrate evil organizations to discover their leaders and their secrets, and expose them for what they are…
I always have a plan for what to do when things go wrong.
I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.
I am always on the lookout for new information regarding the local politics or troop movements.
I appear courteous and charismatic, when in fact I am midleading and deceptive.
I am quiet but very, very observant - with rarely a witness that remembers me…
I will find the evidence that will bring my enemies to their knees.
Should I find myself in an awkward circumstance, I can certainly explain my way out of it.
I ask a lot of questions… to gain a lot of answers… and bring you down…
First rule of spy club… you don't talk about spy club. (Lawful)
I scrutinize those whom would abuse their power.  (Chaotic)
I discover horrible secrets to empower enemy and keep my comfortable standard of living. (Neutral)
I watch, I pass a note, and I maneuver - to eventually take over the world!  (Evil)
I am loyal only to the side that assures my safety. (Neutral)
I am deceptive as a necessary means to bring down an abhorrent evil. (Good)
I am bound to this way of life by a more powerful authority.
I will have justice against the guild or kingdom that murdered my family.
I wait patiently in the shadows… to restore my rightful place in my kingdom.
No one here knows, but I was exiled from my former kingdom for a grip accusation…
My station may appear convincing, but I am actually seeking lost ancient secrets.
I can’t resist swindling people who are more powerful than me.
My disposition is often inane and illogical, but therein lies the whale in cauldron…
When faced with a choice between money and  - nevermind, there is no choice!
I look at the plan, go over the plan, detail the plan, change the plan, look at the plan, go over the plan…
I am ambitious in my efforts, to a fault.
I am easily distracted by the promise of information.
People should adore me for the opportunities I grace them with.
You entertain the crowds to glorify the god of the sea, preferring a net combined with a spear, chain spear, or trident.
You surprise your foes in the arena, choosing to fight with no weapons. And you win!
You fight with two one-handed weapons in a flashy and entertaining fashion.
You prefer to stay as far from your enemies as possible and fill them with javelins and arrows, or other ranged weapons, and a dagger sidearm.
You entertain the crowd with a dazzling performance and amazing accuracy with a polearm.
Using a finesse weapon, spear, or quarterstaff you dazzle your audience with acrobatic maneuvers.
Wearing half armor consisting of a greave, a manica, and a breastplate, you enter the arena with javelins and a shortsword.
You dazzle your audience with swordplay, using any sword or scimitar.
You fight with a beast's head helm, such as a lion, bear, or bull, and wielding a great weapon, terrifying the enemy and your audience.
You fight with a lasso and a dagger, intending to snare and stab your enemy.
I know a story from the arena relevant to almost every situation.
I’m haunted by memories of war. I can’t get the images of violence out of my mind.
I’ve lost too many friends, and I’m slow to make new ones.
I can stare down a hell hound without flinching.
I misuse long words in an attempt to sound smarter.
I get bitter if I’m not the center of attention.
I have a crude sense of humor.
I face problems head-on. A simple, direct solution is the best path to success.
When I destroy my enemy, I make the world better than it was. (Good)
The stories, legends, and songs of the arena must never be forgotten, for they teach us who we are. (Lawful)
The world is in need of new arenas and bold gladiators. (Chaotic)
I’m it for the coition, the mushrooms, and the barbrity of it all. (Evil)
When I destroy my enemy I like seeing the smiles and hearing the cheers of my audience. That’s all that matters. (Neutral)
Battle should reflect the soul; it should reveal who we really are... (Any)
My weapon is my most treasured possession, and it reminds me of someone I love.
Someone swiped my precious weapon, and someday I’ll get it back.
I want to be famous, whatever it takes.
I idolize a gladiator of the old tales and measure my deeds against him/her.
I will do anything to prove myself against my captor.
I would do anything to spare another in the arena.
I’ll do anything to win fame and renown.
I’m a sucker for a pretty face.
A heinous crime prevents me from returning home, ever again.
I once challenged a noble who still wants my head, but the crowds at the arena love me, and I still live…
I have trouble keeping my true feelings hidden. My sharp tongue lands me in trouble.
I haven't stayed alive in the arena this long by being nice.
A guild for wizards, sorcerers, warlocks, and alchemists.
A guild for those that operate caravans, expeditions, and trade campaigns.
A guild for those that trade in illegal items.
A brutal guild for traders in human, demi-human, and monster slaves.
A guild that trades in sellswords, explorers, guides, hirelings, and other mercenaries.
A guild for those that trade in fine items like jewelry, cut gemstones, porcelain, and other fine items.
A guild for those that trade in agricultural deliveries and farm hands.
A guild for houses of ill repute to enforce, protect, and encourage its wares.
A guild for those that trade in riding and other domestic animals, such as horses, livestock, and dire wolves.
A guild for those that deal in the trophy trading of exotic beasts, alive and dead.
A guild for fences, rogues, and brigands, and their wares.
A guild for scholars such as scribes, librarians, academics, philosophers, wizards, and alchemists.
A guild for hiring and training of various actors and impersonators to masquerade and mislead at parties, events, and even royal affairs.
A guild for the best masons, ceramics artisans, miners, and trade in industry metals such as iron and copper.
A guild for those trading in rare artifacts, antiquities, and other exotic items.
A guild for those that trade in smiths, casters, and mine laborers.
A guild that taxes and deals in delivery of precious metals and raw gemstone and its miners.
A guild that deals with carpenters, woodcarvers, wood cutters, lumberjacks, transporters, and builders.
A guild for those that manage textiles, their workers, and the delivery of their various textile resources.
A guild to manage weaponsmiths, dealers, guardianship, and trade in weapons and armor.
I believe that anything worth doing is worth doing right. I can’t help it— I’m a perfectionist.
I’m a snob who looks down on those who can’t appreciate fine art.
I always want to know how things work and what makes people tick.
I’m full of witty aphorisms and have a proverb for every occasion.
I’m rude to people who lack my commitment to hard work and fair play.
I am particularly vile and malicious to the people that work for me.
I don’t part with my money easily and will haggle tirelessly to get the best deal possible.
I’m well known for my work, and I want to make sure everyone appreciates it. I'm always taken aback when people haven’t heard of me.
It is the duty of all civilized people to strengthen the bonds of community and the security of civilization. (Lawful)
My talents were given to me so that I could use them to benefit the world. (Good)
Everyone should be free to pursue his or her own livelihood. (Chaotic)
People are simply an asset; I’m only in it for the money. (Evil)
I’m committed to the people I care about, not to ideals. (Neutral)
I work hard to be the best there is at my craft.
The workshop where I learned my trade is the most important place in the world to me.
I created a great work for someone, and then found them unworthy to receive it. I’m still looking for someone worthy.
I owe my guild a great debt for forging me into the person I am today.
I pursue wealth to secure someone’s love.
One day I will return to my guild and prove that I am the greatest artisan of them all.
I will get revenge on the evil forces that destroyed my place of business and ruined my livelihood.
I’ll do anything to get my hands on something rare or priceless.
I’m quick to assume that someone is trying to cheat me.
No one must ever learn that I once stole money from guild coffers.
I’m never satisfied with what I have - I always want more.
I would kill to acquire a noble title.
I’m horribly jealous of anyone who can outshine my handiwork. Everywhere I go, I’m surrounded by rivals.

My eloquent flattery makes everyone I talk to feel like the most wonderful and important person in the
world.

The common folk love me for my kindness and
generosity.
No one could doubt by looking at my regal bearing that I am a cut above the unwashed masses.
I take great pains to always look my best and follow the latest fashions.
I don’t like to get my hands dirty, and I won’t be caught dead in unsuitable accommodations.
Despite my noble birth, I do not place myself above other folk. We all have the same blood.
My favor, once lost, is lost forever.
If you do me an injury, I will crush you, ruin your name, and salt your fields.
Respect is due to me because of my position, but all people regardless of station deserve to be treated with dignity. (Good)
It is my duty to respect the authority of those above me, just as those below me must respect mine. (Lawful)
I must prove that I can handle myself without the coddling of my family. (Chaotic)
If I can attain more power, no one will tell me what to do. (Evil)
Blood runs thicker than water. (Any)
It is my duty to protect and care for the people beneath me. (Good)
I will face any challenge to win the approval of my family.

My house’s alliance with another noble family
must be sustained at all costs.
Nothing is more important than the other members of my family.
I am in love with the heir of a family that my family despises.
My loyalty to my sovereign is unwavering.
The common folk must see me as a hero of the people.
I secretly believe that everyone is beneath me.
I hide a truly scandalous secret that could ruin my family forever.
I too often hear veiled insults and threats in every word addressed to me, and I’m quick to anger.
I have an insatiable desire for carnal pleasures.
In fact, the world does revolve around me.

By my words and actions, I often bring shame to
my family.
My god (goddess) sent me divine harbingers to bring honor and glory to his name.
I am a knight to prove my love, my adoration, and devotion to one I cannot have.
My ruler has compelled me to serve my country as a noble knight.
I am a knight to honor my father who was a knight before me, and whose father was knight before him, and…
To be a knight is to put worldly needs aside and devote oneself to the common good, thus purifying one's soul.
My temple priest compelled me to become a knight in the name of the temple and our goddess, whom is the best goddess.
It was written in a magical book that I should become a knight.
As a knight, I will bring my wrath upon my enemies, whom shall kneel before me - or die…
My friends know they can rely on me, no matter what.
I work hard so that I can play hard when the work is done.
I enjoy sailing into new ports and making new friends over a flagon of ale.
I stretch the truth for the sake of a good story.
To me, a tavern brawl is a nice way to get to know a new city.
I never pass up a friendly wager.
My language is as foul as an otyugh nest.
I like a job well done, especially if I can convince someone else to do it.
The thing that keeps a ship together is mutual respect between captain and crew. (Good)
We all do the work, so we all share in the rewards. (Lawful)
The sea is freedom—the freedom to go anywhere and do anything. (Chaotic)
I’m a predator, and the other ships on the sea are my prey. (Evil)
I’m committed to my crewmates, not to ideals. (Neutral)
Someday I’ll own my own ship and chart my own destiny. (Any)
I’m loyal to my captain first, everything else second.
The ship is most important—crewmates and captains come and go.
I’ll always remember my first ship.
In a harbor town, I have a paramour whose eyes nearly stole me from the sea.
I was cheated out of my fair share of the profits, and I want to get my due.
Ruthless pirates murdered my captain and crewmates, plundered our ship, and left me to die. Vengeance will be mine.
I follow orders, even if I think they’re wrong.
I’ll say anything to avoid having to do extra work.
Once someone questions my courage, I never back down no matter how dangerous the situation.
Once I start drinking, it’s hard for me to stop.
I can’t help but pocket loose coins and other trinkets I come across.
My pride will probably lead to my destruction.
I was adrift at sea and a pirate ship rescued me and took me in, and I liked it…
My village was attacked and I was taken captive and enslaved by pirates, until I eventually became one of them.
I was banished from my kingdom so I took to a life at sea - and became a pirate!
I was a slave who was sold to a pirate captain, but eventually killed him and took his ship.
My ship was attacked by pirates and the few survivors were taken captive - and I found this life fit me just fine.
I was held captive and forced to fight with pirates for a very long time, but I finally escaped… but that has not stopped their pursuit of me.
I was part of a naval rebellion, but the rebellion failed; so we fled with the ship and became pirates.
They call us pirates, but we call ourselves the imperial resistance.
